results.adx_keywords: Georgia Criminal Case Against Trump (2020 Election);Trump, Donald J;Georgia
results.byline: By Alan Feuer, Luke Broadwater, Ben Protess and Jonah E. Bromwich
results.title: The Trump Georgia Indictment, Annotated
results.abstract: The indictment unveiled on Monday, August 14, charges former President Donald J. Trump with 13 crimes related to his efforts to reverse his election loss in Georgia.
des_facet: Georgia Criminal Case Against Trump (2020 Election)

results.adx_keywords: Colleges and Universities;Politics and Government;College Athletics;Conservatism (US Politics);New College of Florida;Sarasota (Fla)
results.title: At a College Targeted by DeSantis, Gender Studies Is Out, Jocks Are In
results.abstract: A Florida school targeted by DeSantis is becoming unrecognizable.

media.caption: Chris Rufo, a New College board member, in May at the college, where he signed a measure banning initiatives to improve diversity, equity and inclusion.

results.adx_keywords: Social Media;Special Prosecutors (Independent Counsel);Courts and the Judiciary;Presidential Election of 2020;Appeals Courts (US);Howell, Beryl A;Smith, Jack (Attorney);Trump, Donald J;Musk, Elon;Twitter
results.byline: By Alan Feuer and Maggie Haberman
results.title: Special Counsel Obtained Trump’s Direct Messages on Twitter
results.abstract: The nature of the messages or who exactly wrote them remained unclear, but it was a revelation that such messages were associated with the former president’s account.

media.caption: Prosecutors for the special counsel, Jack Smith, sought “all content, records and other information” related to former President Donald J. Trump’s Twitter account from October 2020 to January 2021, according to court papers.

results.adx_keywords: Happiness;Buddhism;Altruism;Content Type: Personal Profile;internal-sub-only;Ricard, Matthieu
results.title: The ‘World’s Happiest Man’ Shares His Three Rules for Life
results.abstract: A searching, playful, provocative discussion with the Buddhist monk Matthieu Ricard.

results.adx_keywords: Libel and Slander;Newspapers;Suits and Litigation (Civil);News and News Media;Freedom of Speech and Expression;Freedom of the Press;Discrimination;Homosexuality and Bisexuality;Tomczyk, Cory;Wausau Pilot & Review, The;Wisconsin
results.title: Report on Anti-Gay Slur Could Put Local News Site Out of Business
results.abstract: When a north-central Wisconsin news site reported that a businessman had uttered a homophobic slur, he sued, claiming defamation. The legal bills are piling up.

media.caption: Shereen Siewert, editor of The Wausau Pilot and Review, said she had no idea how she could continue paying both her lawyers and her staff of four.
media.copyright: Narayan Mahon for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Abortion;State Legislatures;Elections;Politics and Government;Ohio
results.title: The Limit Does Not Exist for Republicans
results.abstract: The attack on bodily autonomy is an assault on both political equality and reproductive freedom.

media.caption: Republican officials in Ohio did not get the low turnout they seemed to be hoping for in a special election held this summer.
media.copyright: Maddie McGarvey for The New York Times

results.byline: By Glenn Thrush and Danny Hakim
results.title: Georgia Case Lays the Ground for Parallel Prosecutions of Trump
results.abstract: The district attorney in Georgia and the special counsel converged on the same conclusion: that Mr. Trump and his allies “knowingly and willfully joined a conspiracy to unlawfully change the outcome of the election.”

Georgia Criminal Case Against Trump (2020 Election)

media.caption: Fani T. Willis, the Fulton County district attorney, and Jack Smith, the federal special counsel, both have announced indictments against former President Donald J. Trump.

results.adx_keywords: Movies;Social Media;TikTok (ByteDance)
results.title: They Review Movies on TikTok, but Don’t Call Them Critics
results.abstract: On MovieTok, reviewers can reach an audience of millions and earn tens of thousands of dollars per post. “Critics,” they say, are old news.

media.caption: Maddi Koch, who has three million followers on TikTok, says she makes videos to spare people “the pain of arguing over finding a movie or not knowing what you’re really looking for.”
media.copyright: Madeline Gray for The New York Times

results.title: Take a Bow, Madonna
results.abstract: Madonna accomplished what few artists and even fewer female artists have done: She has changed the world.

results.adx_keywords: Compensation for Damages (Law);Suits and Litigation (Civil);Sex Crimes;Computers and the Internet;Cyberharassment;Sexual Harassment;Chicago (Ill);Harris County (Tex);Texas;Houston (Tex)
results.title: Woman Is Awarded $1.2 Billion in ‘Revenge Porn’ Lawsuit
results.abstract: A jury ruled in favor of a Texas woman who said her ex-boyfriend had psychologically and sexually abused her by sharing intimate images of her online without her consent.

media.caption: A jury in Harris County, Texas, ordered Marques Jamal Jackson to pay $200 million for mental anguish and $1 billion in punitive damages to a woman identified in court documents by the initials D.L.

results.byline: By Michael S. Schmidt and Glenn Thrush
results.title: Hunter Biden’s Lawyer Steps Down From Case
results.abstract: The decision by the lawyer, Christopher J. Clark, is the latest development in the long-running negotiation between the Justice Department and Hunter Biden.

media.caption: Hunter Biden’s lawyer, Christopher J. Clark, stepped down early Tuesday and now intends to testify as a witness.

results.title: Iced Coffee and Flip-Flops as Europe Broils? Not So Fast, Americans.
results.abstract: As large numbers of U.S. tourists visit Europe during a record hot summer, their efforts to stay cool are running up against cultural norms.

media.caption: With this summer’s heat waves in Europe, Americans wearing shorts and ordering ice water may butt up against etiquette and norms in some areas.

results.title: Your Clothes Were Never Meant to Fit You
results.abstract: The fashion industry was never built to cater to women’s bodies. But there’s a simple solution: Just make it, toots.

results.title: She Was Brazil’s Barbie. Now She’s Saying Sorry.
results.abstract: Xuxa was once Brazil’s biggest TV star. Now many are wondering whether a thin, blond, white woman was the right idol for such a diverse country.

media.caption: Xuxa on a television show on the network Globo in the 1980s. She says she now laments the beauty standards she portrayed.

results.adx_keywords: Wildfires;Electric Light and Power;Infrastructure (Public Works);Suits and Litigation (Civil);Hawaiian Electric Co Inc;Pacific Gas and Electric Co;Hawaii;Lahaina (Hawaii);Maui (Hawaii)
results.byline: By Peter Eavis, Ivan Penn and Thomas Fuller
results.title: Experts Scrutinize Hawaiian Electric as They Search for the Maui Wildfire Cause
results.abstract: The main utility serving Hawaii did not pre-emptively shut off power before high winds reached Maui, and power lines fell in the windstorm.

media.caption: In Lahaina and other towns in West Maui last week, downed power poles and lines littered the highway, blocking roads in some cases.
media.copyright: Philip Cheung for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Football;Movies;Football (College);Suits and Litigation (Civil);Oher, Michael;Baltimore Ravens
results.title: ‘Blind Side’ Player Says He Was Conned With Adoption Promise
results.abstract: Michael Oher, whose life was depicted in the 2009 film, says in a lawsuit that he was never fully adopted by the family that took him in and was swindled into signing away his decision-making powers at 18.

media.caption: Michael Oher during a game in 2010.
